programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton and Allen go up against their former assistant and Allen faces a difficult decision when negotiations to sell a stunt ramp go south.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les gets invited to give a lecture at a local business school. Meanwhile, Ashley and Bobby J go to war over a collection of Nerf guns.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les questions Ashley's management skills when two employees get into a fight on the shop floor. Meanwhile, Seth stumbles upon a potentially huge deal.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank rummage around a machine shop in search of rare collectibles.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: The hunters have to deal with poachers who have stolen the animals caught on their lines.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: A furious storm causes havoc on the highway. Plus, Jamie takes a call that turns into the most challenging recovery his heavy rescue team has had to make all season.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers bargain over a Colt revolver, a coffee machine, presidential pins and a spinning wheel.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers inspect a 1965 Chevrolet Impala, meet a man hoping to sell a 1775 Massachusetts war bond, and examine a classic 1946 Seeburg jukebox.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les hatches a secret plan to put his employees to the test, but how will Seth, Ashley and Karen react when they find out.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: When Ashley interferes with one of Karen's sales on the shop floor, a family feud breaks out. Meanwhile, a rock metal group drops by.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts examine the link between aliens and the Civil War, exploring Abraham Lincoln's strange visions and ghostly images seen at Gettysburg.

programme.title: Conspiracy Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Some people predict that a cataclysmic event will soon spell the end of the human race. This programme examines if there is a way to survive if disaster struck.

programme.title: Conspiracy Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: A look at the advanced technology the US military is using, from flying saucers to killer drones.

programme.title: Engineering Disasters
programme.desc: Two freight train collisions that happened at the same crossing within a year, the collapse of a stage at the Indiana State Fair that left seven concertgoers dead, and an explosion in New York City that leveled two buildings and killed eight people in their homes. Plus, the gaping hole that appeared on an airliner at 36,000 feet, and how engineers in Japan coped with the looming release of radioactive material.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The brokers come across top-secret maps and plans for the Second World War battle of Iwo Jima. Additional items include a 1967 Ford F-100 truck.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers examine a classic 1967 Rokon Trailbreaker motorbike and a collection of rare Muhammad Ali memorabilia. They also have to decide whether a 1715 Escudo Spanish gold coin is a fake.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers get hold of the first-ever issue of Playboy, which featured pictures of Marilyn Monroe, and examine an engraved whale's tooth that could be a piece of scrimshaw from the 19th century.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers examine an edition of Dante's Inferno that dates back hundreds of years. They also consider an antique serpent-shaped sword and the rights to photographs of Michael Jackson.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders visit an upmarket retirement community, where Darrell Sheets buys a unit filled with furniture, and Jarrod Schulz takes a gamble on a safe.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders take a risk on units in a Californian town rich in Spanish-American culture.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: An auction in Norwalk becomes challenging when Allen and Ton go up against a cowboy couple. A grappling hook and a 3D printer are some of the lots in the auction.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: An auction in Whittier sees a buyer named Big Dave try to take it all. The guys win a cool food truck and an off-road rock crawler after some losses.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les finally lands a buyer for his special edition Lee Iacocca Mustang, but loses his cool when he learns Seth sent the hot rod out on consignment.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Part one of two. Karen comes up with a big idea for the shop, while Byron puts two ice hockey fans in their place when they get physical over a vintage puck.

programme.title: Engineering Disasters
programme.desc: The sinkhole that swallowed part of the National Corvette Museum in Kentucky in February 2014. Eight rare and unique Corvettes, plus the floor and portions of the display stands and rails fell into the hole resulting in $1million damage. The phenomenon is caused by the gradual dissolving of rocks, such as limestone, beneath the earth's topsoil.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: What would happen if a UFO actually did land on Earth and humans found it? Engineers create a 'spaceship' to see how alien technology could work..

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate ancient man's apparent obsession with building pyramids, and consider whether extraterrestrials may have helped with their construction.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Scientists explore the possibility that sightings of alien beings or UFOs may actually be evidence of time travellers from the future.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: The crews battle for territory as they begin to work out the blue fin hotspots, but teams clash and tempers begin to flare as they head to the same part of the ocean.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton and Allen try to raise money to fix their bread truck by selling an industrial grinder and a classic Chevy at auction.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen and Ton find a collection of street art which could be highly valuable if it is genuine. They also check out a collection of vintage bear traps.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Specialists in the field of the extraterrestrial study evidence across 75 million years to validate the theory that there has been extraterrestrial intervention on Earth.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: A look at a theory that suggests aliens may have colonised an ice-free Antarctica, before a global event plunged it into the Ice Age.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry Weiss finds a miniature piano in a locker full of hair salon supplies, while Dave Hester makes a bid for a unit.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The experts head to Long Beach, California, where high-end imports and low-income housing mean that every unit is a risky purchase.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: An auction in Norwalk becomes challenging when Allen and Ton go up against a cowboy couple. A grappling hook and a 3D printer are some of the lots in the auction.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: An auction in Whittier sees a buyer named Big Dave try to take it all. The guys win a cool food truck and an off-road rock crawler after some losses.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Actor, writer and TV presenter Richard Ayoade takes over the reins for an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with Pointless co-host Richard Osman and comedian Kiri Pritchard-McLean joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig asks questions relating to animals that start with a P. Regular panellist Alan Davies is joined by comedian Phill Jupitus, broadcaster Danny Baker and actress Teri Hatcher, who all try to come up with interesting answers.

programme.title: Insert Name Here
programme.desc: Historian Kate Williams and comedians Lucy Porter, Chris Addison and Al Porter join host Sue Perkins and captains Richard Osman and Josh Widdicombe on the comedy panel show. In this edition, the two sides answer questions about famous people past and present who share the name Steve, with the winners earning the right to pick the greatest bearer of the moniker - prompting comic banter, funny facts and unusual stats as the teams vie to outdo each other.

programme.title: Josh
programme.desc: It a proud day for Josh's football team - Plymouth Argyle - as they have reached the Football League Trophy Area Final Southern Section. Unfortunately, Owen's cousin has moved in on probation and is hogging the television with his N64 video game console. Meanwhile, Kate helps her mother dump her new boyfriend. Comedy, starring Josh Widdicombe, Jack Dee and Beattie Edmondson.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Beat the Internet with John Robins
programme.desc: The comedian hosts as members of the public are pitted against each other in a quest to predict how search engines respond to a series of questions.

programme.title: Beat the Internet with John Robins
programme.desc: The comedian hosts as members of the public are pitted against each other in a quest to predict how search engines respond to a series of questions.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank face the Georgia Gambler, while Danielle and Robbie may have struck gold.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: The Alvarado brothers stumble across an interesting collectible, while Brandon and Lori bid on a storage facility for pets.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Jesse and the Alvarado brothers get devious, while a frustrated Brandon and Lori look as if they might end up leaving the auction empty-handed.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz unearth a musical treasure at an old general store, and a hoarder's house refuses to give up its secrets.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Two siblings are better than one when it comes to negotiating, which has Mike looking to bundle in order to save his bottom line.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event from Auckland, where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill.

programme.title: Top Gear: Winter Blunderland
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May present their best winter challenges, including playing ice hockey with Suzukis and what occurs if you ski-jump a rocket-powered Mini.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers are on alert for a cartel ambush as they transfer a Sicario to the Mexican military. A random inspection of a pick-up truck reveals 32kg of narcotics.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: The workshop struggles to convert three quad bikes into frontline police vehicles, while an officer has to crash a pursuit car to protect the public. Steve wants to share his home-made birthday cake - if only he can persuade someone to eat it.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond is dropped into the remote, frozen wastes of Canada to test a watch with a built-in emergency beacon. The distress signal is sent directly to Jeremy Clarkson and James May, who get their hands on two machines and set off on an epic adventure to find their colleague. Plus, Jeremy puts the new 471bhp Lexus RC F coupe thought its paces, while The Fall and The X-Files star Gillian Anderson takes to the track in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear: Winter Blunderland
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May present their best winter challenges, including playing ice hockey with Suzukis and what occurs if you ski-jump a rocket-powered Mini.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets tasks to a series of celebrity guests, ultimately deciding who wins. This time, Mark Watson tries to open an unlocked briefcase.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedy panel show, hosted by Rob Brydon, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by celebrity guests Bob Mortimer, Gabby Logan, Katherine Parkinson and Steve Backshall to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: TV presenters Alex Jones and Rick Edwards, comedian Greg Davies and performance poet John Cooper Clarke join forces with team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the panel show in which participants attempt to deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Insert Name Here
programme.desc: Comedians Nish Kumar and Katherine Ryan, historian Kate Williams and sports presenter Gabby Logan join host Sue Perkins and captains Richard Osman and Josh Widdicombe as the comedy quiz returns. The two teams answer questions about famous people who share a name, with the winning trio getting to decide the greatest-ever bearer of this week's moniker.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts an extended edition of the comedy panel game, in which the questions are so difficult points are awarded for interesting - but not necessarily correct - answers. Joining regular panellist Alan Davies are guests Aisling Bea, Lee Mack and Jason Manford.

programme.title: Meet the Richardsons
programme.desc: Comedy series starring real-life married couple Jon Richardson and Lucy Beaumont as they offer a fictional view of their life together. Jon is given career advice from his comedy hero, Jack Dee. Meanwhile, Lucy signs Jon up to be the celebrity judge at the World Dock Pudding Competition in Hebden Bridge.

credits.actor: Lucy Beaumont as they offer a fictional view of their life together

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Mark Watson and Nish Kumar make toast together and Sally Phillips spreads absinthe on it. Greg Davies dishes out the absurd A-list challenges once more.

programme.title: Dara O Briain's Go 8 Bit
programme.desc: Simon Gregson and Jayde Adams play a series of video games, including Super Mario Bros, Call Of Duty Advanced Warfare, and Rock Band.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Comedian and actress Jo Brand takes over the reins for an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with Independent Group MP Heidi Allen and stand-up Phil Wang joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Nazi occupation of Holland, which began relatively peacefully with Dutch civil servants continuing to run their own country, but eventually resulted in many thousands of deaths through the attempted elimination of Jewish citizens and starvation of the non-Jewish inhabitants. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: A profile of Robert Cecil, a formidable political operator who devised and established an extraordinary web of spies and informers designed to ensure King James I's security.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: Profile of Cardinal Richelieu, who as Louis XIII's diabolical chief minister, was feared and hated thanks to his complex spy network.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: The story of Zofia Potocka, the lover of Russian military leader Grigory Potemkin, who ran a successful spy network in the Russo-Turkish War of 1787-92.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates one of history's most enduring mysteries as he goes on a world-wide search for the Holy Grail, visiting Glastonbury in Somerset, Wales, Valencia in Spain, and New York City to inspect four goblets that could be the ancient relic.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: A look at how corruption became rife within the SS, with the money stolen from Jews finding its way into the pockets of the camp guards rather than funding the war effort. Many of the SS also enjoyed illicit sexual relationships with female prisoners. Meanwhile, Dr Mengele embarked on a gruesome series of experiments, using children as guinea pigs in his research into genetic inheritance.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Nazi occupation of Holland, which began relatively peacefully with Dutch civil servants continuing to run their own country, but eventually resulted in many thousands of deaths through the attempted elimination of Jewish citizens and starvation of the non-Jewish inhabitants. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The creation of London's Crossrail network, a project of staggering proportions, with 10,000 personnel working across 40 sites and on 118km of track. The focus should have been on the impressive engineering feat, though delays and budgets have become the focus of attention.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: How Europe's most advanced power station became a film set. Plus, the structures made by scientific pioneer Nikola Tesla in his quest to provide the US with free electricity.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: How China has developed one of the world's fastest high speed rail networks, allowing 75 million people across the country to reach Shanghai within an hour.

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: The other side of the monsoon, as the winds bring dry air and drought. Budgerigars swarm in the Australian desert, gathering at a precious waterhole, and although birds of prey try to ambush them, they are mesmerised by the array of bright colours on show. On the island of Borneo, a bearded pig hunts for seafood on the beach, while in the Rajasthan desert, nomads haggle over the price of camels, which can provide vital transport during this lean season. The mugger crocodiles of Sri Lanka stalk the animals taking a much-needed drink and a young leopard learning to hunt discovers there is no such thing as an easy meal. Colin Salmon narrates.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: An exploration of the effects of the eruption of volcanos in the ocean. From these violent beginnings emerge islands and coral reefs that are home to a vast array of wildlife, including giant manta rays and vampire bugs that thrive in the tropical snow, after a process that takes millions of years. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of the Tokyo Skytree, the world's tallest free-standing tower, which uses liquid springs and safety glass to withstand earthquakes and high winds.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The events of 1944, when the death toll rose substantially. By this point, the Allies were aware of Auschwitz's purpose, and faced a difficult decision over what should be done about it. Plus, the story of the occupation of Hungary, revealing how Adolf Eichmann offered to spare a million Jews in return for certain services.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates an account of the liberation of Paris and Brussels in 1944, events which to many signified the end of the war. However, as the German forces retreated, Poland fell victim to one of the most tragic events of the war, Documentary chronicling the Second World War.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The stories behind closed roads, including a route once used by the French Resistance and areas made impassable by crumbling hills and sand dunes.

programme.title: VE Day: Countdown to Peace
programme.desc: This compelling documentary celebrates the approaching 75th Anniversary of freedom and peace in Europe.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Peace evades the inmates of Slade Prison, and Fletcher's bid to find a little tranquillity seems destined to fail. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Brian Wilde.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Blanco ends up in the prison hospital, where he fears he is about to shuffle off this mortal coil and entrusts the whereabouts of his stashed fortune to fellow inmate Fletch, who is sharing a ward with him. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber takes up boxing and enters the prison championships. He is hot favourite to win until Fletcher is given the task of fixing the contest and nobbling his cell-mate. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, Richard Beckinsale and Peter Vaughan.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Edmund writes Prince George a speech to help quell growing anarchy among the masses - but is none too pleased when the dim-witted royal hires a pair of superstitious actors to teach him how to deliver it properly. Comedy, guest starring Hugh Paddick and Kenneth Connor, with Rowan Atkinson and Hugh Laurie.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Edmund needs to get his hands on some cash and asks the Prince Regent for a raise - only to find the brainless royal has lost all his money playing cards. To remedy the situation, the butler decides he will have to find George a bride with a large dowry and introduces him to the daughter of a wealthy industrialist. Comedy, guest starring Miranda Richardson and Warren Clarke, with Rowan Atkinson, Tony Robinson and Hugh Laurie.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: The fearsome Duke of Wellington challenges Prince George to a duel. Edmund volunteers to take his place, secretly intending to have his insane Scottish cousin MacAdder fill in for him. Comedy, guest starring Stephen Fry, with Rowan Atkinson, Tony Robinson and Hugh Laurie.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Sam Ryan carries out a post-mortem on the body of an ex-student with ritual markings cut into his chest - and suspicion for the killing soon falls on the mysterious owner of a stately home steeped in black magic. Drama, starring Amanda Burton and Mick Ford.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: As her trial nears, Yvonne learns the drunk she recently assaulted has been called to give evidence against her, and tearfully tells Tony she is sure the prosecution have enough evidence to put her away for a long time. Amber is paired up with Honey and sent to find the man responsible for two date-rape incidents, but puts herself at risk trying to catch the suspect and almost becomes his latest victim. Phil beats up Steve for sleeping with Kate Maltby, while Zain introduces Smithy to an informant who has had two fingers chopped off by Pete Larson, and warns he runs the risk of losing a more intimate part of his anatomy if he's not careful.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A motorist has a heart attack behind the wheel, and the resulting smash-up sees Nick risking his life to save a man trapped in a phone booth by a blazing car.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ian confronts Kathy about vicious rumours, but finds the truth hard to take. Mrs Hewitt tries to find Arthur but runs foul of Mark and Nigel looks ready to play happy families.

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Dave is court martialed after attacking an NCO in a jealous rage, and faces the possibility of being discharged from the army. Starring Robson Green.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Equipment has been stolen from the company's stores, and the theft threatens Anderson's chances of promotion. Starring Robert Glenister.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: As her trial nears, Yvonne learns the drunk she recently assaulted has been called to give evidence against her, and tearfully tells Tony she is sure the prosecution have enough evidence to put her away for a long time. Amber is paired up with Honey and sent to find the man responsible for two date-rape incidents, but puts herself at risk trying to catch the suspect and almost becomes his latest victim. Phil beats up Steve for sleeping with Kate Maltby, while Zain introduces Smithy to an informant who has had two fingers chopped off by Pete Larson, and warns he runs the risk of losing a more intimate part of his anatomy if he's not careful.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Kyla reluctantly agrees to let Justin take Max with him to play football, but the inebriated physio fails to realise the youngster is unwell. Nick is still determined to secure a job at St Luke's, and manages to get himself invited to a charity soiree Lord Byrne will be attending. However, the evening ends in chaos when a distressed waiter accuses Connie of killing his fiancee and lets off a bomb.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A disillusioned Sean says his goodbyes, leaving Tina in emotional turmoil, while a psychic woman's eerie predictions perplex Holly, and an overworked, over-stressed man finds working in a bank can pose a serious health risk. Medical drama, starring Ian Bleasdale, Cathy Shipton and Claire Goose.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jack takes a break from paperwork to help investigate a case alongside CID officers, only to discover his increasingly wayward son Ben may be the mastermind behind a major-league drugs operation. Yvonne's trial gets under way, and Laura Bryant begins work as a PC, while a sceptical Sheelagh kidnaps a youngster allegedly suffering from leukaemia, unwilling to believe there's anything wrong with her.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: People are talking about Cindy around the square but can Ian deal with the dirty rumours and Mark has a gift for Adrian and Mandy to cheer them up.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Grant is worried about Nigel and wants to have a chat, he asks Mandy to take the dog out for a walk. Richard is pursuing Shelley.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A man returns home to witness an explosion at his house and sees a figure leaping from the upstairs window. Firefighter Jack Morgan joins the team.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: A mysterious stranger appears on Isobel's doorstep and she persuades Paul to take him to Glenbogle, where he strikes up a rapport with Donald. Golly struggles to tell Molly about his involvement with Meg, and Jess is bothered by her father's meddling ways. Simone Lahbib and Alexander Morton star.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Beth and Karen hunt for a hit-and-run motorcyclist after finding an old man lying injured by the road _ but are they on the right track? Joe reacts badly to Tom's admission about the true nature of his relationship with Beth and the men of Skelthwaite set out to make the perfect curry, but find they can't manage without the culinary expertise of eight-year-old Molly. Drama, starring Kerrie Taylor and Julian Lewis-Jones.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon and Tracey's heating breaks down, leaving them with no one to turn to - except their man-hungry neighbour Dorien. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Beth and Tyler announce they have become vegetarians and set off to Ludlow races to protest about the treatment of animals. Meanwhile, Jed's scarecrow in the barn is mistaken for a human body, and Marlene enrols on a mail-order reiki healing course as part of a plan to create a massage parlour and beauty salon at the farm.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Who Made a Bit of a Splash in Wales Then?
programme.desc: Compo and Clegg gatecrash Foggy's trip to see a female friend in Wales. Comedy, starring Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The trio lament the lack of fresh vegetables available due to a shortage of 'good honest muck' and wonder what it takes to find a half-decent carrot. Whimsical comedy, starring Peter Sallis, Brian Wilde and Bill Owen.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: A young woman's body is found in a seemingly idyllic Northumberland coastal village in 1966, and the subsequent investigation leads Gently and Bacchus to suspect the victim's estranged husband is responsible for the killing. However, they soon come to realise her disturbed family is hiding an even more shocking secret. Starring Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby, with Daniel Casey (Midsomer Murders), Shaun Dooley (Married Single Other), Paul Kaye (Two Thousand Acres of Sky) and Greg Hemphill (Still Game).

credits.actor: Paul Kaye (Two Thousand Acres of Sky)

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The body of a missing computer expert turns up in a hospital morgue under a false name, so the team reopens the investigation into his disappearance. The dead man worked for the Metropolitan Police, giving him access to a great deal of sensitive information - added to which, he was in contact with a group of online hackers. But he died of natural causes - so why was his body hidden, and by who? As the seasoned detectives unravel the mystery, Brian struggles to accept Steve as the new Ucos member, forcing Esther to intervene. Guest starring Sarah Smart and Alex Jennings.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: A troubled Vietnamese student seeks Sam's advice on her arranged marriage to an older man, and shortly afterwards a fire guts the restaurant owned by the father of her husband-to-be. A man's charred body is found among the ashes and post-mortem tests prove he was murdered, giving events a sinister twist. Amanda Burton and Clare Higgins star.

programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Barging Round Britain with John Sergeant
programme.desc: The broadcaster ventures onto the Oxford Canal, which meanders its way through the heart of the gentle English countryside. En route he visits Tooley's Boatyard - the oldest working such facility in Britain, gets to play a hero of his - Inspector Morse, and bumps into a group of floating thespians.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: The GMB team is joined by Lorraine Kelly for the final hour, with the latest on the coronavirus pandemic, as well as other stories.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Another helping of topical studio discussion from a female perspective, featuring celebrity interviews.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five friends answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Murdo, Renee, Don and Anette pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Will hasn't returned home and Harriet is in the dark over what is going on, while an excited Rishi decides he wants to go camping for his 70th birthday. Priya is disappointed that she has to attend her father's party over spending time with Al, and Belle frets at the thought of Jamie going on holiday with Andrea.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: An exhausted Yasmeen sits in her police cell while the police search No 6 for evidence, unaware that they are being filmed on Geoff's CCTV. Alya returns from Spain and heads straight to the police station, Gary leaps to Kelly's defence when Dev blames her for heaping so much trouble on Asha, and Adam and Sarah return from their honeymoon.

programme.title: Absolutely India: Mancs in Mumbai
programme.desc: Brothers Ryan, Adam and Scott Thomas embark on a journey to trace their family roots in India, joined by their dad Dougie, whose father was born in Mumbai. However, the trio have never visited the country they descended from. In the second episode, Ryan, Adam and Scott attempt to find their inner zen at a huge meditation hall, and Scott gets a fiery fix-up Indian style by a hairdresser who prefers flames to scissors. Later, a special family meeting leads to showman Dougie hitting the stage in Mumbai.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul meets a 10-week-old collie who has been rejected by its mother, and helps to find a home for a mongrel called Hope who has been at Battersea for over 300 days. Elsewhere, Paul has got his work cut out when a family of nine whippets arrive on site, including some three-week-old puppies in need of some love.

programme.title: Isolation Stories
programme.desc: Four short dramas depicting life in lockdown. The worst fears of paranoid, self-absorbed hypochondriac Mike have come true. There is an unstoppable virus that affects us all, and he can catch it just by breathing the same air as other people. As he struggles to cope with his fears during the Covid-19 outbreak, he insists on an online session with his old friend and therapist, Rochelle.

programme.title: Innocent
programme.desc: Alice and Rob's relationship continues to disintegrate as evidence under questioning incriminates them further and the children grow closer to David. Meanwhile, Tom's attempts to save his marriage are destroyed by his subsequent arrest, and forensic evidence throws new light on David's original conviction.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show presented by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme.

programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of five family and friends answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The design and manufacture of tank-piercing 'super bullets', and the creation of dentists' drills.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters - Best Buys
programme.desc: Treasure hunter Drew Pritchard counts down some of his most memorable buys, from the incredibly rare and valuable to the exquisite and the quirky.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: A confrontation on the Cornelia Maria results in the police being called, and a debilitating injury ends the career of a Kodiak deckhand.

programme.title: Dive Wars Australia
programme.desc: The documentary following dive crews working off the coast of South Australia returns, as the gang prepares to risk life and limb seeking prized abalone once more.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: An office block in Stafford is torn down just metres from commuter trains. Plus, in North Yorkshire, a Tornado jet is repurposed for life-saving fire training.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer heads to Italy to search for a rare Fiat Dino Coupe, but the car he finds needs extensive work by expert mechanic Edd China before it can be sold.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini fulfils a lifelong dream when his 1952 Muntz Jet is awarded a coveted spot on the lawn of the Pebble Beach Concours d'Elegance, a prestigious charitable event.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini is asked to sell a collection of Boyd Coddington cars.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The production of 99 per cent of America's raisins in California's San Joaquin Valley. Plus, the manufacture of the world's oldest type of paper.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How do they use ancient techniques and modern technology to produce thousands of tonnes of barbecue charcoal? How do they cook up Japan's soba noodles?.

programme.title: Dive Wars Australia
programme.desc: Documentary following dive crews working off the coast of South Australia, risking life and limb to harvest prized abalone.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: A fierce storm strikes, the crew of the Time Bandit carry out a prank on the Northwestern, and a valued fisherman leaves.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce Crompton buys a rare Sherman tank in Ohio. However, before he sells it on it he wants to boost its authenticity and value, so consultd a tank expert for advice.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: At a Hampshire auction room, Drew Pritchard has the pick of over 500 items from affluent private homes. In Lancaster he is reminded of his passion for Elvis memorabilia.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: On Holy Island, a defunct aluminium factory must be demolished, but a giant steel crane proves tricky.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer purchases a 1976 Porsche 911 Targa for 5,000, hoping Edd China will be able to work his magic on it.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China completes the Porsche 911 Targa, refurbishing the gearbox, improving the roof seal and spraying it black. Mike Brewer then tries to maximise its price.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: In South Australia, rookie miners Daniel Becker and Justin Lang leave their lives behind, risking all to chase an opal fortune.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits the Wirral, where he tours a stately home that doubles as an antique shop, and finds so much worth buying that he worries his finances might be in trouble.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard and Paul Cowland take on their biggest restoration yet, a VW Beetle Karmann Cabriolet. The car is in terrible condition, but Drew is determined to save it from the scrapheap.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz head to South Carolina, where they come across a mammoth collection of militaria that includes Civil War revolvers and even Forrest Gump's original footlocker.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The complex technological processes involved in making off-road vehicles, the best way to stay on a bucking bronco, and how flour is used when making cakes.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How the price of bread is set, the production of speedy lawnmowers, and how coconuts are employed to clean water.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China begins renovation work on a 1984 Jeep CJ7, replacing the suspension and shock absorbers.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China tries to fit the new rear drum brakes and completes a few other jobs, before Mike Brewer tries to sell the vehicle on for a profit.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: An insight into how the smallest pieces of evidence left at a crime scene, such as a fingerprint or a shoe, can be critical in solving a case.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The murder of Philip Gatusso in the quiet town of Fargo in 2009. When police failed to find any leads, they turned to surveillance video for support.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Timothy Moore, whose body was found in a shallow grave in April 2011, five months after he had been reported missing from his home in Washington's Willapa Bay. His son Devon later pleaded guilty to his murder.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Recounting how years after a successful TV producer was gunned down in his New York office, a tip led the FBI to a murderous entertainment industry giant.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: A team of investigators responds to reports of animal cruelty, rescuing pets and dealing with abusive owners.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A baby cockatoo has fallen out of its nest, so Sydney veterinary surgeon Dr Chris Brown tries to help it fly once again.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown fights to save Bluebell, who was dumped at the clinic as a kitten and has now fallen victim to a hit-and-run.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Katherine and Sophie from reality series DC Cupcakes begin their search for Katherine's dream wedding dress, while Suzy and her sister seek an outfit they both love.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A customer finds shopping with her opinionated mother challenging.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A customer tries to bond with her estranged half-sister while shopping for a dress, and a bride looks for the perfect gown to impress her fiance.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A cockatiel is brought in with a broken leg, and Chris Brown carries out a radical treatment involving a pencil, pilates and sticky tape.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown looks after a greyhound that has been dumped after it failed to prove its worth on the racing track.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown helps a cuckoo with an injured leg, rescues two dogs from a rooftop, examines a golden retriever, and checks a koala's eyesight.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown treats a racehorse to see if it can join the unwanted thoroughbred programme. Plus, a dog hit by a car, and a kitten with earache receive attention.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigators try to seize seven horses from a waterlogged field, but find the beasts much more reluctant to leave than they expected.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigators from the Houston SPCA are called to a remote property, where they find five horses - one dead and four in poor health.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: When a killer's dumping ground is discovered in Florida, investigators set out to confirm the identity of charred bones in order to solve the brutal crime.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: When hundreds of exotic birds were found dying at a reputable aviary in June 1994, owners and breeders Moses Lall and Lila Buerattan were nowhere to be seen. Detectives in Floriga had to ascertain whether the missing pair had left their property willingly. In the event, the mystery would endure for years to come.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 24-year-old Amy Wroe Bechtel, who vanished in July 1997 while on a jog in Wyoming. The investigation into her disappearance spanned several years and covered hundreds of square miles.

programme.title: The Perfect Murder
programme.desc: The murder of inventor and pharmaceutical mogul millionaire Bill McLaughlin, who was found shot dead in his Newport Beach kitchen in December 1994. The police suspected his disabled son, but doubted whether he would have had the capability to carry out such an act. Some 15 years later sufficient evidence came available to convict his former girlfriend Nanette Johnston.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: How some brides struggle to find the perfect dress, and their idea of a perfect wedding can be put in doubt.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride-to-be brings scorecards to rate her gowns, while another has her first fitting. Plus, the annual Blowout Sale begins.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A woman's sorority sisters surprise her with a weekend trip, but there is something fishy about their appointment. Bride-to-be Lauren tries to please her aunt.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Camille brings along her mother-in-law, in the hope of improving their relationship. Plus, consultant Keasha helps her friend to find the perfect dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: New consultant Carmel receives a tall order from her first customer of the day, while another woman wants to spend $2,000 on an elaborate red dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A woman refuses to stay within her budget while shopping for a dress, while Dorianne's father becomes emotional during her fitting.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three Brits get to scout round a special trade market in Paris with 800 euros to spend and expert dealer Mark Franks on hand. They then head to Harrogate, North Yorkshire, to sell the items, with whoever makes the most profit set to walk away with everyone's winnings. Noorie struggles to buy anything at all, Mark turns a suitcase into a table and Jessica reupholsters a bench seat for less than 60

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Dan takes his sister to test drive a monster truck, Wendy comes across a handbag that could be very valuable, and Larry and Neil examine some works of art bought in a pub.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: James, 38, has lost his father and sister to obesity-related issues and he is facing the same fate - unless he can turn his life around and shed the pounds.

programme.title: My Feet Are Killing Me
programme.desc: Surgery to correct a woman's webbed toes becomes a crisis for Dr Schaeffer when she develops a dangerous complication that could cost the patient her toes.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: In Peru, diver Alejandro's body has blown up like a balloon, and Marc from Germany has to drink 20 litres of water every day or risks death.

programme.title: Dead of Winter
programme.desc: Days before Christmas, Robbie Schmidt is found strangled to death, but just when the case seemed to be going cold, his brother comes forward with a shocking secret.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How killers try to mislead detectives by making a murder look like suicide, and the role of forensics in establishing the truth.
